verses.verse: To the chief <WH5329> Musician <WH5329> upon Gittith, <WH1665> A Psalm of Asaph. <WH623> Sing <WH7442> aloud <WH7442> to God <WH430> our strength: <WH5797> make a joyful noise to the God <WH430> of Jacob. <WH3290>
Take <WH5375> a psalm, <WH2172> and bring <WH5414> here the tambourine, <WH8596> the pleasant <WH5273> harp <WH3658> with the psaltery. <WH5035>
Blow <WH8628> up the trumpet <WH7782> in the new <WH2320> moon, <WH2320> in the time appointed, <WH3677> on our solemn <WH2282> feast <WH2282> day. <WH3117>
For this <WH1931> was a statute <WH2706> for Israel, <WH3478> and a law <WH4941> of the God <WH430> of Jacob. <WH3290>

This he ordained <WH7760> in Joseph <WH3084> for a testimony, <WH5715> when he went <WH3318> out through <WH5921> the land <WH776> of Egypt: <WH4714> where I heard <WH8085> a language <WH8193> that I understood <WH3045> not.
I removed <WH5493> his shoulder <WH7926> from the burden: <WH5449> his hands <WH3709> were delivered <WH5674> from the pots. <WH1731>

You called <WH7121> in trouble, <WH6869> and I delivered <WH2502> you; I answered <WH6030> you in the secret <WH5643> place of thunder: <WH7482> I proved <WH974> you at <WH5291> the waters <WH4325> of Meribah. <WH4809> Selah. <WH5542>
Hear, <WH8085> O my people, <WH5971> and I will testify <WH5749> to you: O Israel, <WH3478> if <WH518> you will listen <WH8085> to me;
There shall no <WH3808> strange <WH2114> god <WH410> be in you; neither <WH3808> shall you worship <WH7812> any strange <WH5236> god. <WH410>
I am the LORD <WH3068> your God, <WH430> which brought <WH5927> you out of the land <WH776> of Egypt: <WH4714> open your mouth <WH6310> wide, <WH7337> and I will fill <WH4390> it.
But my people <WH5971> would not listen <WH8085> to my voice; <WH6963> and Israel <WH3478> would <WH14> none <WH3808> of me.
So I gave <WH7971> them up to their own hearts' <WH3820> lust: <WH8307> and they walked <WH3212> in their own counsels. <WH4156>
Oh <WH3863> that my people <WH5971> had listened <WH8085> to me, and Israel <WH3478> had walked <WH1980> in my ways! <WH1870>
I should soon <WH4592> have subdued <WH3665> their enemies, <WH341> and turned <WH7725> my hand <WH3027> against <WH5921> their adversaries. <WH6862>
The haters <WH8130> of the LORD <WH3068> should have submitted <WH3584> themselves to him: but their time <WH6256> should have endured <WH1961> for ever. <WH5769>
He should have fed <WH398> them also with the finest <WH2459> of the wheat: <WH2406> and with honey <WH1706> out of the rock <WH6697> should I have satisfied <WH7649> you.
